jsocket.socket

Interface Socket

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ObjectSocket, StringSocket
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ObjectSocketImpl, SocketImpl, StringSocketImpl

    public interface Socket
    Wraps a Socket and simply sends and receives bytes Base interface for this package Lowest level in abstraction
    Version:
    0.1.0
    Author:
    Will Czifro

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the input and output streams and closes socket connection
      byte[] receive()
      Receives data as byte array
      byte[] receiveAll(int size)
      Receives data of certain size as byte array
      void send(byte[] data)
      Sends data as byte array
      void setBufferSize(int bufferSize)
      Sets the default buffer size for receiving data
      void setSoTimeout(int timeout)
      Set a timeout on the socket InputStream.

    • Method Detail

      • setBufferSize

        void setBufferSize(int bufferSize)
        Sets the default buffer size for receiving data
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - size of default buffer

      • receive

        byte[] receive()
        Receives data as byte array
        Returns:
        data

      • receiveAll

        byte[] receiveAll(int size)
        Receives data of certain size as byte array
        Parameters:
        size - number of bytes to read in, overrides bufferSize for this single method call
        Returns:
        data

      • send

        void send(byte[] data)
        Sends data as byte array
        Parameters:
        data - data to be sent

      • setSoTimeout

        void setSoTimeout(int timeout)
        Set a timeout on the socket InputStream. Look to Socket for more info
        Parameters:
        timeout -

      • close

        void close()
        Closes the input and output streams and closes socket connection
